import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
source.0cdf36fe:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))
chart = sns.countplot(x = 'Item', data=IndiaData)
chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=90, horizontalalignment='center')
chart.plot()
source.58588a5c:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))

source.502e22f1:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
dat = IndiaData[IndiaData['Element']=='Production']
chart = sns.countplot(x = 'Item', data=dat)
chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=90, horizontalalignment='center')

source.070bb0eb:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
export_data = IndiaData[IndiaData['Element']=='Export Value']
sns.lineplot(x = 'Year', y='Value', data=export_data)
source.a5c986e0: In last 15 years, India has always been importing and exporting around 80-90 fertilizers.
source.90044a46: India has been producing only 11 fertilizers.
source.2cf2b940: India has been using Urea, Ammonium Sulphate, CAN, SOP fertilizers in higher amounts for agricultural use.

source.75606d31: 'NPK fertilizers' has generated most of the revenues in India.
source.b349c782: Highest import-export of fertilizers happened in year 2011.
source.f7f0359d: India generated largest revenue around 8000 x 1000 US$ in 2009 year through exportation.
source.bd4623e2: Urea and Ammonium sulphate are two mostly used fertilizers in India.
source.b92853fd: You can see from above graph that, India has exported more number of fertilizers rather than importing them most of the times.
